Body.Content:
Introduction

Community admins can now broadcast live events using the enhanced Microsoft Teams town hall experience, a more powerful and flexible way to connect with your audience. Teams town hall brings forward familiar features from Teams live events while introducing new advanced capabilities designed to support high-quality, large-scale event delivery with greater ease.

This message is associated with Microsoft 365 Roadmap ID 499896.

When this will happen

General Availability (Worldwide): We will begin rolling out on early September 2025 and expect to complete by mid-September 2025.

How this affects your organization

Community admins will find Teams town hall as a new default option when creating live events, alongside the legacy Teams live events. You can choose between the two options based on your needs. Users may benefit from a higher-quality viewing experience and additional engagement options when events are hosted using the new Teams town hall experience.

What you can do to prepare

Once available, Teams town hall will appear by default as an option for community admins when creating live events in your community, alongside the legacy Teams live events option. This update requires no configuration or action from admins or tenants. 

Compliance considerations

Compliance AreaExplanation
New communication methodThe enhanced Teams town hall introduces a new way for community admins to broadcast live events, offering advanced capabilities for large-scale communication.
Admin controlThe feature is enabled by default and appears as a selectable option for community admins. While no configuration is required, admins can choose between legacy Teams live events and the new Teams town hall experience.
User controlCommunity admins can choose whether to use the new Teams town hall or continue with legacy Teams live events when creating live events.
